<@U048C858Y94> Yes, I am referring to the dark grey on the side. It’s the part of the email body.
 I have marked in the screenshot below-

So this is going to be an issue with other code in your email. You’ve done the right thing by setting your image to 100% width. But something else is restricting it’s size. Is this a drag-and-drop email, or a custom template?
<@U048C858Y94> Yes its a drag and drop template but with a custom module for the image.  I created the custom module by adding the CSS code I shared above.
Then as far as I'm aware you are out of luck. I'm fairly confident that the code that is creating those margins is not editable in a drag and drop template.
I just saw that you are using a drag and drop template. You have no control over dark mode issues like this.
<@U048C858Y94> Ohh Ok. What would you suggest in that case? Do we need to create a custom email from scratch by coding?

In my opinion, the amount of effort required to fix this issue by creating a custom email template far outweighs what you’re actually gaining. Most issues inherent with using drag-and-drop emails are a much bigger deal than what you’re experiencing. If it were me I would just leave it as is and move on.
And also, for what it’s worth, subjectively I think this looks great and I think that if the gray margins were missing that it would look worse. :shrug:
